Package chess

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class for Piece representation. Provides default functionality for determining color, position, and whether piece has moved, as well as the abstract method getMoves() for Piece specific directional implementation.
Author:
Pavan Mahankali, Joshua Su

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    boolean bounded
    Field for checking if piece is bounded (has movement restricted to a maximum distance) or unbounded (no distance restrictions apart from board boundaries)

    Field for checking piece color, true if white, false if black

    Fields for horizontal and vertical coordinates for Piece position.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece​(boolean color, int xx, int yy)
      Abstract constructor to maintain all pieces have a color and location
      Parameters:
      color - piece color (true if white, false if black)
      xx - horizontal position of the piece
      yy - vertical position of the piece

  • Method Details

    • getMoves

      public abstract directions[] getMoves()
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to define Piece-specific directionality
      Returns:
      Piece-specific array of directions

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(int xx, int yy)
      Sets position of this piece to specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      xx - horizontal position to be set
      yy - vertical position to be set

    • isWhite

      public boolean isWhite()
      Returns:
      true if Piece is white, false if Piece is black

    • getPosition

      public directions getPosition()
      Returns:
      directions object containing (x,y) coordinates of Piece.

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Returns:
      true if Piece has been moved, false otherwise

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns:
      X field of piece, i.e. the horizontal position (file)

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns:
      Y field of piece, i.e. the vertical position (rank)

    • isBounded

      public boolean isBounded()
      Returns:
      true if Piece movement is bounded, false otherwise

    • moved

      public boolean moved()
      Returns:
      sets value for hasMoved() to true

    • print

      public java.lang.String print()
      Returns:
      Piece notation String
